column4: Is there actually a way to get wmv files running in a web browser (Opera or even just Firefox) within Ubuntu? Or should I stop looking?
install totem-xine & the w32codecs, works for most people
I've had some success with k3b
I think that's what I used with suse, but i'm trying to avoid using kde stuff in gnome
I mentioned the one I had the best success with ; gnomebaker & gravman work ok
aptitude shows packages that used to exist but don't anymore :)
well, apt-cache policy <packages> will at least tell you if that's the case
tamale, swear I just said that ;)
didn't see it, I dropped in late ;)
simplest is Gorlist to move, mv
urg, I don't even remember what I started to answer, got called from my desk ;(
touch typing can be hazardous on irc
I asked about restricted drivers (which is now fixed), you told me the mv command? :P
nah, that was for Gorlist . But since I touchtyped, didn't see I had an incomplete sentence started
